intro: Cynorkis frappieri, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer. Cynorkis frappieri is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens.
